intro: Euphrasia × lundensis, commonly known as the hybrid eyebright, is a perennial herb native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its small, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream sides. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are clustered in racemes. Euphrasia × lundensis is often used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported eye-soothing properties.
